You may have Allergy.
An allergy is an immune system response to  foreign susbstance that is not typically harmfull to your body.They can include certain foods, pollen, pet dander. Your immune system's job is to keep you healthy but fighting harmfull pathogens.
Precautions:apply calamine cover with bandage, use ice to compress itching.

patterns: irregular sugar level,obesity,increased appetite,blurred and disorted vision
irregular sugar level,blurred and disorted vision,excessive hunger
responses:
You may have diabetes.
Diabetes is a disease that occurs when your blood glucose, also called blood sugar, is too high. Blood glucose is your main source of energy and comes from the food you eat. Insulin, a hormone made by the pancreas, helps glucose from food get into your cells to be used for energy.
Precautions:have balanced diet,exercise,consult doctor

You may have typhoid.
Typhoid is an acute illness characterized by fever caused by infection with the bacterium Salmonella typhi.Precautions:eat high calorie vegitables,antiboitic therapy,consult doctor,medication

You may have migraine.
A migraine can cause severe throbbing pain or a pulsing sensation, usually on one side of the head. It's often accompanied by nausea, vomiting, and extreme sensitivity to light and sound. Migraine attacks can last for hours to days, and the pain can so severe.
Precautions:meditation, reduce stress,use poloroid glasses in sun, consult doctor

You may suffer with Jaundice.
Yellow staining of the skin and sclerae (the whites of the eyes) by abnormally high blood levels of the bile pigment bilirubin. The yellowing extends to other tissues.
Precautions:drink plenty of water,consume milk thistle,eat fruits and high fiberous food,follow medication

You may have Asthma.
Asthma is a medical condition which causes the airway path of the lungs to swell and narrow. Due to this swelling the air path produces excess mucus to hard to breathe which results in short breathe and wheezing.
Precautions:don't be in cool places for longer time, follow good medication, consult a doctor

Thyroid occurs when  your thyroid gland produces too much of the hormone thyroxine.

TB is an infectious disease usually caused by Mycobacterium tuberculosos bateria. It afffects lungs and other body parts.

Gastroenteritis is an inflammation of digestive tract, prticularly large and small intestines.

You may have Hypertension.
Hypertension is long term medical condition in which the blood pressure in artheries is persistently elevated it is also called as blood pressure(bp).
precautions:regular meditation, reduce salt intake, reduce stress, get proper sleep

You may have Sinus.
Sinus occurs as the result of inflammatory reaction and infection from virus, bacteria,fungus.
Precautions:drink plenty of water, avoid cold drinks and cold foods, don't get wet in rain,consult a doctor

You may have dengue.
Dengue is a viral infection that is caused from the mosquitoes.
Precautions:prevent yourself from mosquitoes,consult a doctor and follow good medication.

You may have PCOS(Polycystic Ovary Syndrome).
PCOS is condition where you have unusual or very long periods.
Precautions:Avoid fried foods, avoid fat contained foods, consult a doctor and follow good medication.

patterns: high body temperature, body pains, cold, cough
responses: You may have fever.Fever in humans is defined as having a body temperature above the normal range due to an increase in the body's temperature set point in the hypothalamus. Precautions:More liquid food intake, avoid spicies, take good medication, consult a doctor if temperature of baody is greater than 100F

You may have Malaria.Malaria is a mosquito-borne infectious disease that affects humans and other vertebrates.Human malaria causes symptoms that typically include fever, fatigue, vomiting, and headaches.Precautions:use mosquito nets, consult a doctor and follow good medication

patterns: red spots on skin, fatigue, fever, itching, sore throat, scab, loss of apetite
responses: You may have Chicken pox.Chicken pox, also known as varicella, is a highly contagious, vaccine-preventable disease caused by the initial infection with varicella zoster virus (VZV), a member of the herpesvirus family.Precautions:get two doses of chicken pox vaccine, avoid contact with others who might be susceptible, consult a doctor.

patterns: stiffiness of neck, pain in limbs, fatigue, vomiting
responses: You may have Polio.Poliomyelitis, commonly shortened to polio, is an infectious disease caused by the poliovirus.Approximately 75% of cases are asymptomatic.mild symptoms which can occur include sore throat and fever in a proportion of cases more severe symptoms develop such as headache, neck stiffness, and paresthesia.Precautions:Get vaccinated and stay hygiene

You may have Cholera.Cholera is an infection of the small intestine by some strains of the bacterium Vibrio cholerae.Symptoms may range from none, to mild, to severe.The classic symptom is large amounts of watery diarrhea lasting a few days.Vomiting and muscle cramps may also occur.Diarrhea can be so severe that it leads within hours to severe dehydration and electrolyte imbalance.Precautions:Stay hydrated, stay hygiene and consult a doctor

patterns: swelling of breast skin, scaling of breast skin, flaking of breast skin, readness of breast skin, change in size
responses: You may have Breast Cancer.Breast cancer is cancer that develops from breast tissue.Signs of breast cancer may include a lump in the breast, a change in breast shape, dimpling of the skin, milk rejection, fluid coming from the nipple, a newly inverted nipple, or a red or scaly patch of skin.In those with distant spread of the disease, there may be bone pain, swollen lymph nodes, shortness of breath, or yellow skin.Precautions:Stay away from alcohol, smoking, spicy food, sugars. Must consult a doctor and get good treatment

patterns: severe pain in stomach, stomach pain, constipation, bloating
responses: You may have Stomach Ache.Abdominal pain, also known as a stomach ache, Is a symptom associated with both non-serious and serious medical issues. Since the abdomen contains most of the body's vital organs, it can be an indicator of a wide variety of diseases. Given that, approaching the examination of a person and planning of a differential diagnosis is extremely important.Precautions:Drink plenty of water, fluids. Reduce intake of alcohol,coffee,tea.

patterns: backache, vomiting, diarrhoea, severe headache, malaise, skin rashes
responses: You may have Small pox.The initial symptoms of the disease included fever and vomiting.This was followed by formation of ulcers in the mouth and a skin rash.Over a number of days, the skin rash turned into the characteristic fluid-filled blisters with a dent in the center.The bumps then scabbed over and fell off, leaving scars.Precautions:Get vaccinated, consult a doctor.
